quest.name: Foxfire
journal: Kyokuho appears frantic...and Master Murakumo is nowhere to be found.
Murakumo has yet to return from his survey of the southerly shrine, and Kyokuho has a bad feeling that his master may be in grave danger. Hurry to Rakusui Gardens and search the area.
Murakumo was not to be found in Rakusui Gardens. Kyokuho suggests you next visit the westerly shrine on the Short Pier.

You and Kyokuho arrive to find the aged master clutching a wound suffered at the hands of one of Kinko's minions. Murakumo pleads with his pupil to allow him to be the sacrifice that seals the barrier for good, but before any vital humours are spilled, Lady Leveva appears seemingly out of nowhere to offer a solution that will conveniently save the day, without having to resort to bloodshed. Hurry with Leveva and Kyokuho to Kugane Castle to set the lady's plan in motion.
Following a heated battle that takes you through the heart of Kugane, Kinko is finally defeated, her spirit cleansed and her anger quelled.

A new barrier has been erected using energies drawn from both land and heavens. With Kugane safe, Kyokuho must decide where his journey shall take him next. Speak with the geomancer atop Tasogare Bridge.

The prophecy has been fulfilled─friends new and old having joined to overcome disaster and achieve hope and new knowledge. One day, maybe the star-crossed companions' paths will cross again.

※The next astrologian quest will be available from Jannequinard once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “The Soul of Temperance.”
objectives: Search for Murakumo in Rakusui Gardens.
Speak with Kyokuho at the westerly shrine.
Await the final showdown outside Kugane Castle.
Defeat the spirits before they can harm the citizenry.
Weaken Kinko Kugane then heal her wrath and anguish.
Cast Aspected Benefic to subdue Kinko Kugane.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Forename! Thank the stars you are finally here.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: It's been almost four bells since Master Murakumo left on his daily inspection of the bonds. He most likely just stopped to warm his belly along the way, but I can't help wondering if it's something worse. Will you help me search for the old man? We can start at the closest shrine in Rakusui Gardens.

dialogue.name: UDOKU
dialogue.text: Well look what we have here, boys. The pretender is back with his ijin lapdog to do...whatever it is they're doing. Tell me again, what exactly is it you're doing?

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Not here but two beats of the heart and I'm accosted by Udoku and his merry band of minions. I'll handle these three while you search yonder for Master Murakumo.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Well, any sign of him?

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Where could he be? You don't suppose he tried anything foolish, do you? With the bonds as weak as they are, any manner of disturbance could rouse the golden fox...and the master is no longer of an age to defend himself.

dialogue.name: UDOKU
dialogue.text: Defend himself against what? A maid could walk the streets naked and unattended carrying a gold-filled sack and not have so much as a finger laid upon her. Or are you spreading more lies about angry spirits to sow fear so that you might offer your “protection” in exchange for a bugyo's ransom?

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: I've done no such thing! I've merely bid my fellow geomancers aid the city in its time of need. Not once have I asked compensation for what I seek! If anything, it is you who seek to prey on the citizenry's ignorance!

dialogue.name: UDOKU
dialogue.text: Hah! So says the talentless hack who waves his great-grandfather's name around like he does his member! Your lies are growing stale, Kyokuho. Continue spouting them, and not only do you sully our craft, but the very legacy of Grandmaster Kazan. What would he say to this nonsense!?

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Are you even listening to me? Why does no one listen to me!? All I desire is to mend my great-grandfather's magicks and save Kugane! I do not seek coin! I do not seek fame! Why is that so hard for you to grasp!?

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Gah! We are wasting our time here, Forename. Let us continue the search for Master Murakumo at the westerly shrine.

dialogue.name: UDOKU
dialogue.text: Quite the performance. Perhaps the pretender should trade in his geomancer's robes for mummer's paint. Hah hah hah hah!

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Master Murakumo! Are you hurt!?

dialogue.name: MURAKUMO
dialogue.text: The bond...was nearly undone... I...tried to... But the...... Argh!

dialogue.name: MURAKUMO
dialogue.text: Kinko... She's here. She's already through. We...we need to perform the blood ritual. It is the only way...

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: No. I already told you. My great-grandfather spurned the spilling of innocent blood to complete the seal, and so have I. Besides, even if we were to conduct the ritual, there is no one to sacrifice.

dialogue.name: MURAKUMO
dialogue.text: Then I shall be the sacrifice, Kyokuho. For the many years since your grandfather passed, my sole purpose has been to find a means to mend Kazan's barrier. It would be the greatest honor knowing that with my death, I might not only save the city, but be granted the opportunity to watch over it for eternity.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: No! I can't let you die, Master!

dialogue.name: MURAKUMO
dialogue.text: Listen to what you are saying, Kyokuho. You cannot let me die? I want to do this. It is my decision to make and mine alone. Let not this selfishness in your heart distract you from what needs to be done.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: You're wrong, Master! There must be another way. There is always another way! There is always hope!

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Right, Forename? Tell me! How do we save Kugane!?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What do you suggest?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's simple. Use astrology.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's simple. Sacrifice Master Murakumo.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Stop focusing on the bonds, and look to the fox? What do you mean, Forename?

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: What shehe means?

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: I'll tell you exactly what shehe means!

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: (-???-)Not on my watch!

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: There is a much easier solution to all this nonsense...but only if you stop focusing on the bonds, and turn your attention to the fox!

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Lady Leveva! How did y─ Where did y─ Why did y─ Lady Leveva...?

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: Your powers of observation never cease to amaze me, Kyokuho. Aye, it is me, in the flesh. Fresh off a galley put into port this very morn.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: The symposium was a rousing success, the Vault quick to realize the benefits my school's wisdom could bring when applied to the rebuilding of Ishgard. It was even decided that several new courses in Sharlayan astrology were to be taught at the scholasticate starting next term.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: And so, with my father's dream fulfilled, I was finally free to pursue whatever I wished...and I wished to learn more of geomancy. So here I am...and not a moment too soon, by the looks of it.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: In the few bells I spent exploring the city for leads as to your whereabouts, I learned much and more about our “pretender” and his end-is-nigh advocacy, so I began testing the bonds of this barrier myself. It did not take long to realize that it was Kyokuho who was speaking verily, and his detractors the true pretenders.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: So, you'll help us mend the bonds!?

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: But how? Forename and I have already tried using energies drawn from the heavens, and that only worked to delay the inevitable.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: The guardian spirit's strength has grown so great that the only thing that might hold her now is a new barrier anchored with bonds of lifeblood─but this I cannot allow.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: As always, Kyokuho, your hasty charge into a difficult answer blinds you from the simple solution. You were right to harness the power of Aspected Benefic─but you failed to grasp its true potential to bring succor.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: For so long you have focused on mending your great-grandfather's bonds, when you should have focused on Kinko herself. If her wrath can be quelled, then a barrier will no longer be needed.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: So...you're saying that if we use the power of the stars to soothe Kinko's wounded heart, we may convince her to stay her attack?

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: Giving you time to re-lay your great-grandfather's bloodless bonds. But it will only work if Kinko is weak, and the manifestations of her soul's scars cleansed.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Right! So we only need to─ Wait. Won't attacking Kinko and her spiritual minions simply anger her even more?

dialogue.name: MURAKUMO
dialogue.text: Before something can be healed, it must first be hurt. It is a sound plan, Kyokuho. And...if it turns out you still require a sacrifice, I─

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: There will be no sacrificing tonight, tomorrow, or ever! The stars have foretold our victory and will provide us the strength we need to see our enemy overcome!

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: That's what I like to hear! Follow me, then, to Kugane Castle! The spirits are certain to be drawn there!

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: The fox is a creature of the night. If Kinko is to reveal herself, it will be under the cover of darkness.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: Trust in the heavens...and always trust in yourself.

dialogue.name: UDOKU
dialogue.text: The very hells have opened! Who will save us!?

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Tenkonto? We just walked up all those steps for a final showdown at Kugane Castle, and now we have to walk all the way back down to Ten─ Right. Mouth shut.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: Kinko will seek to draw our attention away from her by sowing chaos in the streets. Kyokuho, you focus your energies on the fox. Forename, you make swift work of her angry supplicants. I shall provide you both with support from the rear.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Kinko is attacking the people of Kugane!
We have to save them!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defilers of the land, hearken unto me! Tonight there shall be a reckoning!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: She flees! We can use this time to deal with Kinko's thralls before giving chase.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: What is this I smell...? The blood of he who dared keep me from my rightful domain! Kazan!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The fox thinks I'm my great-grandfather...and it doesn't appear she's all that thrilled to see me...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Your insolence is neither forgotten nor forgiven! It is you I shall devour first!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hurry! We must not afford her time to heal her wounds!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Look there! So overwhelming are her wrath and anguish that they have taken shape!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: This light... Its warmth...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The flames within recede with the morning tide...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Her anger─we must soothe it once and for all!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hath man finally learned his power need not only be used for destruction? Perhaps my guardianship is no longer required...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Now! She is ready!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Forename!
Tap into the stars and guide their soothing energies through Kinko!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Great-grandfather... I have failed...you...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: This wasn't in the morning's reading...

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: Kinko is calmed! Now lay the bonds and complete your great-grandfather's ritual!

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: May the rivers of heaven and earth, wind and water, flow together as one. May their currents cleanse this land of its impurities and see it ever guarded.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: May the wrath that once held rule be carried to the seas where it be forgotten...for eternity.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: It is done. Together we have saved Kugane, and with it torn down the walls that separated our two schools. This will be a day long remembered─the day a new hope was born.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: “At the end of the path of disaster is hope.” I'm not going to say I told you so...but I told you so. <wink>

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: I don't know how to begin to thank you─both of you.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: Normally, I would say that this uncharacteristic display of humility is more than enough thanks, but I still require one thing in return for my assistance─a promise that this is not the end.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Of course it's not the end! This is just the beginning─a new beginning for both geomancy and astrology! There's so much to be done. First, we'll need to write down all that happened here today, then I'll need to─

dialogue.name: JANNEQUINARD
dialogue.text: So this is Kugane, eh? Not bad.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: Jannequinard!? What in the seventh heaven's name are you doing here!? I explicitly stated in my letter that you were not to follow me!

dialogue.name: JANNEQUINARD
dialogue.text: Lady Leveva. I am disappointed. You of all people should know had you wanted me to stay put, you should have rather demanded that I come.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: Yes, yes. Whatever was I thinking?

dialogue.name: MURAKUMO
dialogue.text: Ahem. May I say that I am honored to have before me the foremost authorities on astrology. Your display last night taught me there is still much I must learn about my own school.

dialogue.name: MURAKUMO
dialogue.text: Something I would not have been able to do had I...er...allowed myself to be sacrificed.

dialogue.name: UDOKU
dialogue.text: Kyokuho! I... I wanted to...ap─ To apol─ Apol─

dialogue.name: UDOKU
dialogue.text: To apologize. There, I said it.

dialogue.name: UDOKU
dialogue.text: I still despise you and that smirk of yours, but I can see I was mistaken about your being a pretender. You have talent...almost as much as I. You will make a worthy rival.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Hah! Coming from you, Udoku, I'll take that as a compliment.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text:
Lady Leveva, under any other circumstances, I would be on a barque headed back to Eorzea this very evening to complete my training as an astrologian. But there is something I need to do first. Just as you fought to educate Ishgard of your school, I must do the same here in Kugane with mine.
A geomancy unfaithful to the teachings of the masters has poisoned this city for too long.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: A wise decision─one that was surely not easy for you to make.

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: Take as much time as you need, Kyokuho. See the ship righted. See truth prevail. The stars will guide you back to us when the hour is right.

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: Don't you worry Lady Leveva. Give me a few summers and I'll have an entire army of geomancers trained by yours truly lining up at your desk!

dialogue.name: LEVEVA
dialogue.text: An...entire army of Kyokuhos...?

dialogue.name: KYOKUHO
dialogue.text: What? Is that a problem? Hah hah hah!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the astrologian quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “The Soul of Temperance.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next astrologian quest will be available from Jannequinard.
